text.content: Click a Lesson or Activity to learn more about Play and the Four Pillars.
How does play influence children's cognitive development?

Cognitive development is the construction of thought processes, including:
  • Memory
  • Problem solving
  • Reasoning
  • Language development
  • Decision making

Key Messages
  • Child-initiated play lays the foundation for learning and academic success.
  • Through play, children explore their creativity and imagination and learn many important problem-solving skills.

graphic.notes: Ekness Playing with smileÂ—Talaris Play Photos Folder (mom smiling while playing with twin toddlers

audio.transcript: The previous page explained the role of play in each of the four pillars of development. So why has this play module been included in the Learning and Cognitive Development pillar? Because play is one of the best ways to encourage healthy cognitive development.

As discussed in the Overview to this course, cognitive development is defined as the construction of thought processes, including memory, problem solving, reasoning, language development, and decision making. Play helps children develop all of these skills.

As you review the lessons and activities in this topic, keep in mind this topic's Key Messages: child-initiated play lays the foundation for learning and academic success; and through play, children explore their creativity and imagination and learn many important problem-solving skills. In your role as an Early Childhood Professional, you play a key role in encouraging parents to provide the time and space for play in their children's life. In this way, you help parents supprot their children's healthy social, emotional, and cognitive development.
